intro: Picris spinulosa, commonly known as the thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its stems are covered in stiff, bristly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Picris spinulosa is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
